poem:
### Birds of Prey

In the grip of night, mechanical wings  
whisper over razor wire.  
A silent migration,  
delivery of ghosts—the tiniest of parcels  
unveiling chaos while the world sleeps.  
From distant skies, they descend,  
bearing gifts wrapped in gray,  
lifting captives on fleeting flights  
from glass and steel purgatories.
